page.title: 08HOUSING ESTATES FLATS
page.content: Maidstone follows the general urban pattern. At the corner of Union St. are modern flats where nineteenth century terraced housing used to be. Much of this still remains, though some has been modernized and pedestranized in the last ten years. Further out are small private estates and council semi- detatched dwellings with small gardens; e.g. Park Avenue. Beyond this are private estates built in the late 60's to accommmodate overspill from the town; e.g. Vinters Park. There are larger houses along Sittingbourne Rd. of all ages with various functions, including colleges and vets. In surrounding villages, housing is mainly semi-detatched estates with some historical buildings depending on age. Individual farm houses are scattered across the countryside.
